intro: Aquartia microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved aquartia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact stature and small, narrow leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of hair. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale green or white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Aquartia microphylla is considered a species of conservation concern.
